Package agile.planner.scripter.exception

Class InvalidGrammarException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • agile.planner.scripter.exception.InvalidGrammarException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class InvalidGrammarException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    InvalidGrammarException is a subclass of RuntimeException, upon which it is thrown if the user's code violates the prescribed syntax for a given class or function. This can occur if the user provides too many or too few arguments for a given class or function operation.

    A typical example would be if the user mistakenly forgot a comma when initializing a class: 

         task: hw 3, 0  <-- This will result in an exception

    Another situation might be the user passing arguments to a custom function but in the incorrect order: 

         foo: task, card, label
       add: _task, _card
       add: _label, _task

     task: hw, 3, 0
     card: Math
     label: MA, blue
     foo: _task, _label, _card  <-- This will result in an exception

    The InvalidGrammarException class differs from InvalidKeyWordException, which is thrown only when a duplicate occurs when defining a custom function. This, however, does not prevent the user from defining a custom function with an already existing keyword (such as 'add'). Instead, it will throw an InvalidGrammarException for violating the type or number of arguments based on the existing keyword.

    Since:
    1.0
